intro: Oxypetalum tubatum, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Oxypetalum tubatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
